work.name: URseismo, University of Rochester
work.summary: Develop deep learning models to solve seismic problems & computational imaging problems.

work.name: Interplay Lab (ROC-HCI Lab), University of Rochester
work.summary: Design agentic LLM framework to engage K-12 children in collaborative reasoning.

publications.name: Deep Algorithm Unrolling for Seismic Migration
publications.publisher: 2025 IEEE Conference on Computational Imaging Using Synthetic Apertures
publications.summary: We propose the inverse Radon transform Network (iRADNet), a deep learning-based framework that unrolls the Iterative Shrinkage Thresholding Algorithm (ISTA) into a trainable neural network, enabling automatic learning of parameters for solving the inverse Radon transform. Empirical results demonstrate the effectiveness of iRADNet in reconstructing noisy seismic data, showing enhanced accuracy and computational efficiency. Our code and data are publicly available at https://github.com/URseismology/iRADNet.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
